name: Hyatt Regency Columbus

reviews.text: The service and our room was unexpectedly great at They Hyatt Regency. For a hotel of this age, the rooms have been renovated very well. Everything is new. The decor is tasteful and the room was exceptionally clean.
reviews.title: A Great Stay in Columbus in the heart of the Walkable Short North Adjacent to Downtown

reviews.text: Front desk service was warm and professional - even though we were using points for our reservation.
reviews.title: Nice Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hyatt's location is exceptional. If you know Columbus and haven't recently ventured into the Short North District (a mere block from the hotel), you are truly missing out. I moved from here 15 years ago and was simply amazed at the transformation. The same can be said for the Arena District. This hotel is perfectly located near great restaurants, shopping, galleries and other venues.
reviews.title: Great hotel in downtown Columbus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for business. It was attached to the convention center which was very convienient. There was also a little store at the entrance of the hotel and the convention center that stayed open pretty late and sold just about everything including wine and beer. The room was clean and cozy.
reviews.title: Nice, clean, comfortable, and friendly

reviews.text: The only problem I had was that I had a message. I kept calling for 10 mins trying to find out what the message was, but no one answered. Finally, I went to the front desk. I had to stand in line for 15 minutes only for them to tell me I needed to see the bellmen. So they weren't there and I waited 5 minutes. They told me that someone had sent a package to me at the hotel. I wasn't sure what it was. They told me it would be 20 mins before they could tell me what it was. So I waited and then after 20 mins they still had not brought it up. So someone took me down to their package holding area to see what it was. So then I arranged for someone to deliver it and I tipped him directly. When I checked out, I was charged $10 for package handling. I was upset with this considering the hassle I had to go through with the package. This left a very bad taste in my mouth. VERY BAD TASTE.
reviews.title: Housekeeping nonexistent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed here while attending a concert in the Columbus Arena District. The property is well maintained and has very updated furnishings. The location is a short walk to the Ballpark, Hockey Arena, and the Lifestyles Pavilion. We used the hotels restaurant for dinner and breakfast. Dinner was very good, and the breakfast buffet offered "build your own" omelettes and had lots of fresh fruit that was exceptional. I very highly recommend this hotel for a stay in Downtown Columbus.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: This is a perfect place to stay if you are in the city for a big conference since the hotel is connected to the Columbus Convention centre.
reviews.title: A great stay

reviews.text: The hotel is also located on one of the main streets the High Street North where you can find many local restaurants, galleries, shops, and other interesting activities. The hotel is also located near a nice quite park (for all you joggers out there:) ).
reviews.title: Avoid the Rooms Next to the Elevators

reviews.text: As for the hotel itself, there is a complimentary WIFI but it is only offered in the lobby or at the bar on the second floor. If you want WIFI in your room, the fee varies from 9$ to 18$ depending on the speed. The hotel has a valet parking for 24$ for 24h, but I would recommend parking across the street in a self-parking for 14$ for 24$ (ask the valet at the entrance and they will gladly help you find the place). On my part, I was in Columbus for a conference, so I did not get to taste the hotel’s breakfast, but if you do not want to eat at the hotel, there are numerous and delicious places on High Street North (from local breweries, to local cafes, to steak house, sushi, etc).
reviews.title: Ew.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place to stay.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: I've stayed here several times for work and vacation trips, and found the Hyatt to be one of the best options in town. It is the opposite of boutique-y, and rather dull (and sometimes outdated); however, it is perfectly functional, generally clean and has a very good staff.
reviews.title: Fine, well-located, convention-style hotel with good value

reviews.text: The renovated rooms are nice, with working wifi and, most importantly, power outlets everywhere (by desk, bed, etc).
reviews.title: Small room, poor housekeeping, disappointing

reviews.text: There is nothing special, but generally it you get a lot for your money.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel and Convention Center - Questionable Reservation Process

reviews.text: My largest complaint is a complete lack of soundproofing between rooms. I can hear my neighbor cough, use the hair dryer, listen to TV or music, etc.
reviews.title: A good night's sleep....zzzzz

reviews.text: I haven't stayed at a Hyatt before but because this is the convention hotel for the convention I was attending I really didn't have a choice....I wish I did...
reviews.title: Smells like feet

reviews.text: Not much to say other than I was there to go to an OSU football game and the stay went well. Everything from the delicious chicken quesadilla and drinks at Big Bar, to the comfortable bed I slept in, to the breakfast buffet was enjoyable. I'm sure I'll stay here again on a future return visit. Thanks.
reviews.title: Smooth Stay

reviews.text: I stay in the downtown Columbus area over 30 days per year and always enjoy the Hyatt arena district. It by far is the most consistant of hotels in the area for service, clenlieness and food & drink The rooms have been recently updated with nice ammenities, it is always clean, and the staff are extrememly friendly from valet, restaurant & bar, to front desk. Besides that, for a hotel, the food is extremely good for a hotel. They definatly pay attention to detail when preparing the food from appatizers on up.
reviews.title: Great Location & great hotel

reviews.text: My company booked us here for a conference in downtown Columbus. There are lots of meeting rooms of all sizes which made it the ideal venue. As far as getting to places where you can have a few drinks or grab something to eat, its great too. The front desk staff was great and the rooms were nice and clean. They have a nice restaurant and bar in the hotel and you can get to lots of places via the walkways.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, friendly staff, never have had a problem with this place. Yes the parking might be a bit high but for the location I will pay it! Great views of the city and SHort North. Best place to stay for Gallery Hop too!!
reviews.title: Best hotel in the Short North

reviews.text: Took my son to college this weekend and stayed at the Hyatt. Figured this would be a great place to spend the night before he hits the dorm. The rooms are so outdated, hotel is dark, beds were so uncomfortable, even my 19 year old who usually can sleep anywhere indicated how bad the bed was. I certainly expected alot more for my money and with the name Hyatt Regency attached. Should have saved my money and pulled out the air mattress and slept in the dorm.
reviews.title: Ohio State Parents - Stay Elsewhere

description: 633 guest rooms, including 16 suites, and Hyatt business plan rooms... connected to the Greater Columbus Convention Center.. 63,000 sq ft meeting space, including 15,500 sq ft ballroom and 32 meeting rooms.
